intro: Barleria marghilomanae, commonly known as the Marghiloman barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
